page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area concerned lies a few kilometres west of the city of Wells in Somerset. It contains five settlements of village or hamlet size,namely Wookey,Yarley,Henton and Bleadney. There are also several farms and the overriding impression is one of a rural landscape. A significant feature is that the villages are sited in an almost continuous line along the slightly higher ground just above the old flood levels of the Somerset moors,and they are linked together today by the only road of note in the area, the B3139. To the south,the villages are backed by residual hills of lias rock,such as Ben Knowle Hill. Although of no great height(100 metres maximum) they make a marked contrast with the surrounding flat,low-lying drained moors of clay and peat.
